{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox football biography | name = André Schürrle | image = Andre Schürrle, Germany national football team (06).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Schürrle with [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in 2011 | fullname = André Horst Schürrle{{Cite news| title = 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: List of Players| url = http://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf| publisher = FIFA| format = PDF| page = 16| date = 11 June 2014| accessdate = 6 November 2014}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|11|6|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Ludwigshafen]], Germany | height = 1.84 m[http://www.bvb.de/Mannschaften/Profis/Andre-Schuerrle BVB profile] | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] / [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[Borussia Dortmund]]) | clubnumber = 14 | youthclubs1 = Ludwigshafener SC | youthclubs2 = [[1. FSV Mainz 05|Mainz 05]] | youthyears1 = 1996–2006 | youthyears2 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = [[1. FSV Mainz 05|Mainz 05]] | clubs2 = [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] | years1 = 2009–2011 | years2 = 2011–2013 | caps1 = 66 | caps2 = 65 | goals1 = 20 | goals2 = 18 | years3 = 2013–2015 | clubs3 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps3 = 44 | goals3 = 11 | years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = [[VfL Wolfsburg]] | caps4 = 43 | goals4 = 10 | years5 = 2016– | clubs5 = [[Borussia Dortmund]] | caps5 = 33 | goals5 = 3 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps6 = 22 | goals6 = 6 | nationalteam1 = [[Germany national youth football team|Germany U19]] | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalcaps1 = 11 | nationalgoals1 = 4 | nationalteam2 = [[Germany national youth football team|Germany U20]] | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam3 = [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 4 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2010– | nationalteam4 = [[Germany national football team|Germany]] | nationalcaps4 = 57 | nationalgoals4 = 22 | club-update = 08:55, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:07, 26 March 2017 (UTC) | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry| {{GER}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIFA World Cup]]}} {{Medal|W|[[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]]|}} {{MedalCompetition|[[UEFA European Championship]]}} {{Medal|B|[[UEFA Euro 2012|2012]]|}} }} '''André Horst Schürrle''' ({{IPA-de|ʔanˈdʁeː ˈʃʏɐ̯lə, ʔɑ̃ˈdʁeː -, ˈʔandʁeː -}}; born 6 November 1990) is a German professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], on loan from [[Borussia Dortmund]], and the [[Germany national football team|German national team]]. He began his career at [[FSV Mainz 05|Mainz 05]] in 2009, spending two years at the club before a £6.5 million transfer to [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]]. His performances there gained the attention of [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], who signed him for a reported £18 million in 2013. Schürrle played one-and-a-half [[Premier League]] seasons at the English club before joining [[VfL Wolfsburg]] for £22 million in January 2015, winning the [[DFB-Pokal]] and [[DFL-Supercup]] in his first year. Schürrle has been a full international for Germany since 2010, gaining over 50 caps and scoring 20 goals. He was a member of the German squads which reached the semi-finals at [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and won the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. During extra-time in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]] he provided the assist for [[Mario Götze]]'s winning goal against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Schürrle started his career at local club Ludwigshafener SC at age four, before joining [[1. FSV Mainz 05]] in 2006. He played as a defender before switching to his current position of an attacker.{{cite news |title=Teenage Kicks: Andre Schurrle |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/01/teenage-kicks--andre-schurrle.html |work=Chelseafc.com |date=14 January 2015 |accessdate=10 June 2017}} He spent three years playing for the club's youth teams, where he won the [[Under 19 Bundesliga]] in 2009 under coach [[Thomas Tuchel]].{{cite news |title=Thomas Tuchel's carnival club party on as Mainz maintain perfect start |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2010/sep/23/thomas-tuchel-mainz-bundesliga |work=The Guardian |date=23 September 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2017}} ===1. FSV Mainz 05=== In August 2009, Schürrle made his [[Bundesliga]] debut in a 2–2 draw against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] on the opening day of the [[2009–10 Bundesliga|2009–10 season]].{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=ger/news/newsid=1531919.html | title=Schürrle opts for Leverkusen | publisher=UEFA.com | date=16 September 2010 | accessdate=20 May 2011}} The following month, on 19 September 2009, Schürrle scored his first two league goals in a 3–2 away win against [[VfL Bochum]] before signing a professional contract with the club later in the week.{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/sport/fussball/0,1518,650829,00.html | title=Kurzpässe: Auslosungsmodus der WM-Playoffs unklar, Kuranyi krank | language=German | publisher=Spiegel Online | date=23 September 2009 | accessdate=19 May 2011}} In September 2010, Mainz announced that Schürrle had signed a five-year contract with Bayer Leverkusen, and would join the club at the end of the [[2010–11 Bundesliga|2010–11 season]]. The transfer fee agreed between the two clubs was believed to be in the region of €8 million. ===Bayer Leverkusen=== Schürrle completed his £6.5 million move to Bayer Leverkusen in 2011,{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1173062-chelsea-transfer-rumours-who-is-andre-schurrle |title=Chelsea Transfer Rumours: Who Is Andre Schurrle? |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=4 July 2013 }} signing a five-year contract with the club until the summer of 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22219166 |title=Andre Schurrle: Chelsea hold transfer talks, say Leverkusen |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2013 |accessdate=4 July 2013 }} He scored on his debut in a [[2011–12 DFB-Pokal|DFB Pokal]] tie against [[SG Dynamo Dresden|Dynamo Dresden]]. He had to wait until 15 October 2011 to open his Bundesliga account for Bayer Leverkusen, when he netted a late equalizer against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]], rescuing his side a point as the match finished 2–2.{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/9/1143367/spielanalyse_borussia-mgladbach-15_bayer-leverkusen-9.html |title=Schürrle rettet Bayer einen Zähler |publisher=kicker |date=15 October 2011 |accessdate=4 July 2013 |language=German }} Schürrle registered his first European goal in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] in a home win over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] four days later.{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/clubs/player=250005337/profile/index.html | title=Club History | publisher=UEFA.com}}{{Dead link|date=March 2013}} On 26 September, Schürrle scored his first goal of the season against [[FC Augsburg]] in a 3–1 win.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346360/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=FC Augsburg 1–3 Bayer Leverkusen |publisher=ESPN FC |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010033329/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346360/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=10 October 2012 |df=dmy }} In the fixture against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] on 28 October 2012, Schürrle provided an assist for [[Stefan Kießling]] in a 2–1 win at the [[Allianz Arena]]. This gave Bayern their first loss of the season in the Bundesliga and gave Bayer Leverkusen their first victory in Munich since October 1989.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346323/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Leverkusen shock Bayern |publisher=ESPN FC |date=28 October 2012 |accessdate=28 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130219072808/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346323/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=19 February 2013 |df=dmy }} On 30 March 2013, Schürrle scored twice in the match against [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]], in a 4–1 win.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/gamecast/346161/gamecast.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Leverkusen beat Düsseldorf |publisher=ESPN FC |date=30 March 2013 |accessdate=30 March 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130406185931/http://espnfc.com/en/gamecast/346161/gamecast.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=6 April 2013 |df=dmy }} On 20 April 2013, Schürrle scored a brace and made an assist as they defeated [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] 5–0 at home.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346141/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Schurrle bags brace |publisher=ESPN FC |date=20 April 2013 |accessdate=20 April 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513123106/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346141/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=13 May 2013 |df=dmy }} Schürrle finished the 2012–13 campaign with a tally of 14 goals and 9 assists in 43 games across all competitions.{{cite web | url = http://www.ibtimes.com/chelsea-transfer-news-cavani-bale-hulk-schurrle-linked-blues-1285493 | title= Chelsea Transfer News: Cavani, Bale, Hulk And Schurrle Linked To The Blues | publisher=ESPN FC | date= 30 May 2013 | accessdate = 30 May 2013 | first = Jason | last = Le Miere}} ===Chelsea=== [[File:André Schürrle'14.JPG|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2013]] On 18 April 2013, it was confirmed that Bayer Leverkusen's director of sport [[Rudi Völler]] had travelled to [[London]] to hold talks with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] over the transfer of Schürrle, although no fee had yet been agreed.{{cite web | url= http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8650869/German-side-Bayer-Leverkusen-confirm-talks-in-London-about-Andre-Schurrle | title = German side Bayer Leverkusen confirm talks in London about Andre Schurrle | publisher=skysports.com| date= 19 April 2013 | accessdate = 29 May 2013 | first = Graeme | last = Bailey}} On 13 June 2013, Chelsea confirmed via their official website that they had reached an agreement with Leverkusen for the transfer of Schürrle,{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3208938/title/agreement-reached-for-transfer-of-andre-schurrle |title=Agreement reached for transfer of andre schurrle |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=13 June 2013 |accessdate=13 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613123939/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3208938/title/agreement-reached-for-transfer-of-andre-schurrle |archivedate=13 June 2013 |df=dmy }} with the transfer fee reported to be in the region of €21 million (£18 million).{{cite web | url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2340971/Andre-Schurrle-joins-Chelsea-18m-Bayer-Leverkusen.html | title = Mourinho makes Schurrle his first signing as German seals £18 million move to Chelsea | publisher=DailyMail.co.uk | date = 13 June 2013 | accessdate = 13 June 2013 | first = John | last = Edwards}}{{cite web | url= http://prosoccertalk.nbcsports.com/2013/06/13/andre-schurrle-is-jose-mourinhos-first-signing-as-new-chelsea-manager | title = André Schürrle is Jose Mourinho’s first signing as new Chelsea manager | publisher=NBCSports.com| date= 13 June 2013 | accessdate = 13 June 2013}} On 25 June 2013, Chelsea announced that they had completed the transfer of Schürrle, bringing an end to the Londoners' protracted pursuit of the German forward. With Schürrle signing a five-year contract, he was given the number 14 shirt.{{cite web | url= http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3219878/title/schurrle-signing-completed | title= Schurrle signing completed | publisher=chelseafc.com | date = 25 June 2013 | accessdate = 25 June 2013}} On 4 August, Schürrle scored his first goal in a Chelsea shirt in a pre-season friendly match against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] during a tour of the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3338450/title/schurrle-really-nice-feeling |title=Schurrle: really nice feeling |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=5 August 2013 |accessdate=5 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130808155701/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3338450/title/schurrle-really-nice-feeling |archivedate=8 August 2013 |df=dmy }} On 18 August, Schürrle made his competitive debut for Chelsea, coming on as a 67th-minute substitute for [[Kevin De Bruyne]] in a [[Premier League]] 2–0 win over [[Hull City F.C.|Hull City]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3365344/title/match-report-chelsea-2-hull-city-0 |title=Match report: chelsea 2 hull city 0 |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=18 August 2013 |accessdate=18 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130819041407/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3365344/title/match-report-chelsea-2-hull-city-0 |archivedate=19 August 2013 |df=dmy }} His first goal for Chelsea came in the 2–1 home victory over title challengers [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 27 October, where he scored from a cross by teammate [[Fernando Torres]].{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10407601/Chelsea-2-Manchester-City-1-match-report.html |title=Chelsea 2 Manchester City 1: match report |publisher=The Telegraph |date=27 October 2013 |accessdate=27 October 2013 }} On 7 December, he then scored two goals against [[Stoke City]] in a 3–2 defeat.{{cite web|url=http://kr.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/3566499 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150118045552/http://kr.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/3566499 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=18 January 2015 |title=MATCH REPORT: STOKE CITY 3 CHELSEA 2 |publisher=Chelseafc.com |date=7 December 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2015 }} Schürrle scored his first [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]] the following 1 March, against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in a 3–1 away victory in the [[West London derby]].{{cite web|title=Andre Schurrle's hat-trick sees Chelsea beat Fulham 3–1|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287558/report|publisher=Sky Sports News | date = 1 March 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015}} Three weeks later, he assisted [[Samuel Eto'o]]'s goal in the fifth minute and sent Chelsea into a 2–0 lead in the seventh minute at home to Arsenal; he was awarded Man of the match after Chelsea won 6–0.{{cite web|title= Premier League: Chelsea destroy 10-man Arsenal 6-0 as referee blunders |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287588/report|publisher=Sky Sports News | date = 23 March 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = Rob | last = Parrish}} On 8 April, he scored in Chelsea's second leg [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]], to advance to the semi-finals on the away-goals rule.{{cite web | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/310247 | title = Champions League: Demba Ba's late goal sends Chelsea through against Paris St-Germain | publisher = Sky Sports News | date = 9 April 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = Rob | last = Parrish}} His first season in England ended with eight goals in 30 Premier League matches. On 18 August 2014, in Chelsea's first game of the new league season, Schürrle scored the second goal of a 3–1 victory away to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], from a [[Cesc Fàbregas]] pass.{{cite news|title=Burnley 1–3 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28735901|accessdate=18 August 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=18 August 2014}} This was later voted ''[[Match of the Day]]''{{'}}s goal of the month.{{cite web | url = http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2014/9/15/6153667/bbc-motd-goal-of-the-month-andre-schurrle-vs-burnley | title = BBC MotD Goal of the Month: Andre Schurrle vs. Burnley | publisher = weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com | date = 15 September 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = David | last = Pasztor}} Chelsea finished the season as Premier League champions and Schürrle, despite going on to complete a transfer to Wolfsburg in early 2015, received a medal, having played 14 matches in the league season. He was not aware that he had played enough matches to earn a medal, and was surprised when manager [[José Mourinho]] texted him to tell him of the recognition.{{cite news|title=Andre Schurrle: Jose Mourinho texted me to say I'd won the title|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32740747|accessdate=14 May 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=14 May 2015}} ===Wolfsburg=== [[File:Emirates Cup - Arsenal v Wolfsburg (20012494129) (cropped) Andre Schürrle.jpg|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] in 2015]] {{quote| You have to make a decision, and in the end I only wanted to play football again. Germany manager [[Joachim Löw]] told me it would be a great move for me and that is why Wolfsburg are a step forward for me. Wolfsburg have a great team as well and can play for silverware in the Bundesliga and in Europe.|Schürrle, on his transfer to Wolfsburg, in 2015.{{cite web|title=Mourinho wanted me to stay at Chelsea - Schurrle|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/15/germany/2015/02/18/9034142/mourinho-wanted-me-to-stay-at-chelsea-schurrle|date=18 February 2015|accessdate=18 February 2015}}}} On 2 February 2015, Schürrle returned to the Bundesliga, joining [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] for a fee of £22 million.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31087979 |title=Andre Schurrle: Chelsea forward completes £22m Wolfsburg move |date=13 August 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2015 |work=BBC}} Five days later he made his debut for the club, playing the entirety of a 3–0 home win over [[TSG Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]] and setting up goals for [[Bas Dost]] and [[Kevin De Bruyne]].{{cite news|last1=Banerjee|first1=Rohan|title=Andre Schurrle shines on Wolfsburg debut alongside fellow former Chelsea winger Kevin de Bruyne as they cruise to win over Hoffenheim|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2944051/Andre-Schurrle-shines-Wolfsburg-debut-alongside-fellow-former-Chelsea-winger-Kevin-Bruyne-cruise-win-Hoffenheim.html|accessdate=8 February 2015|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=7 February 2015}} His first goal for the club came on 4 April, in a 3–1 win over [[VfB Stuttgart]].{{cite news|last1=Gill|first1=Kieran|title=Andre Schurrle relieved to score first goal for Wolfsburg after goal drought was 'eating away' at the former Chelsea forward|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3026454/Andre-Schurrle-relieved-score-goal-Wolfsburg-goal-drought-eating-away-former-Chelsea-forward.html|accessdate=7 April 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=4 April 2015}} On 30 May, Wolfsburg won the [[DFB-Pokal]] for the first time after beating [[Borussia Dortmund]] 3–1 in [[2015 DFB-Pokal Final|the final]] at the [[Olympiastadion (Berlin)|Olympiastadion]] in Berlin, Schürrle playing the final nine minutes in place of [[Maximilian Arnold]].{{cite news|title=Dortmund 1-3 Wolfsburg: DFB-Pokal won by De Bruyne and Dost|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/borussia-dortmund-vs-wolfsburg/1683489/report|accessdate=30 May 2015|work=Goal.com|date=30 May 2015}} Schürrle was a 63rd-minute substitute for [[Daniel Caligiuri]] as Wolfsburg won the [[2015 DFL-Supercup]] on 1 August, scoring in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].{{cite news|last1=Dunbar|first1=Ross|title=Bendtner leads Wolfsburg over Bayern Munich on penalties in German Super Cup clash|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/bendtner-leads-wolfsburg-over-bayern-munich-on-penalties-in-german-super-cup-clash-080115?vid=null|accessdate=3 August 2015|publisher=Fox Sports|date=1 August 2015}} On 25 November, after again replacing Caligiuri in the 61st minute, he scored both goals in a Champions League [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] win at [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]].{{cite news|last1=Gadd|first1=Michael|title=CSKA Moscow 0-2 Wolfsburg: Super-sub Andre Schurrle strikes twice to eliminate Russians from Champions League|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3333956/CSKA-Moscow-0-2-Wolfsburg-Super-sub-Andre-Schurrle-strikes-twice-eliminate-Russians-Champions-League.html|accessdate=25 November 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=25 November 2015}} On 1 March 2016, exactly two years after scoring his first club [[hat-trick]] for Chelsea, Schürrle recorded his first treble for Wolfsburg in their 4–0 win against [[Hannover 96]].{{cite news|title=Super Tuesday for Kenedy, Schürrle and Atlético|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2338298.html|accessdate=3 March 2016|publisher=UEFA|date=1 March 2016}} A week later he scored the only goal in a 1–0 (4–2 aggregate) win over Belgian side [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] to advance his team to the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League quarter-finals]] for the first time in their history.{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/uefa-champions-league/match/439167/vfl-wolfsburg-kaa-gent/report|title=Andre Schurrle scores as Wolfsburg advance past Gent|website=ESPNFC.com|access-date=2016-03-08}} ===Borussia Dortmund=== On 22 July 2016, Schürrle joined [[Borussia Dortmund]] for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36864010|title=André Schürrle: Borussia Dortmund sign Wolfsburg winger|newspaper=BBC|access-date=22 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bvb.de/eng/News/Overview/Borussia-Dortmund-sign-Andre-Schuerrle|title=Borussia Dortmund sign André Schürrle|website=Borussia Dortmund official website|access-date=22 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vfl-wolfsburg.de/en/info/news/detailspage/artikel/bvb-bound-43298.html|title=BVB bound|website=VfL Wolfsburg official website|access-date=22 July 2016}} On 14 August 2016, Schürrle made his debut coming off the bench in 2–0 defeat against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[2016 DFL-Supercup|DFL-Supercup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.dfb.de/supercup/spielplan/?spieledb_path=%2Fmatches%2F2234139 |title=Deutscher Supercup, 2016, Finale |date=14 August 2016}} ==== Fulham (loan) ==== On 25 July 2018, [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] announced the signing of Schürrle on a two season loan.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/FulhamFC/status/1022213648763170816|title=Fulham Football Club on Twitter: "Welcome to Fulham Football Club, @Andre_Schuerrle!"|work=Twitter|accessdate=25 July 2018}} On 26 August, Schürrle scored his first goal for the club in a 4–2 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/55/main/2018/08/26/47310392/fulham-4-burnley-2-mitrovic-brace-helps-cottagers-get-off|title=Fulham 4 Burnley 2: Mitrovic brace helps Cottagers get off the mark|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=27 August 2018}} ==International career== [[File:Andre Schürrle, Germany national football team (04).jpg|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in 2011]] ===Youth team=== Schürrle made his debut in a [[UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]] qualifying match against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]], which resulted in a 3–0 win.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} After impressing for [[1. FSV Mainz 05]] in the [[Bundesliga]] he was called up to the [[Germany national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] in 2009.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} ===Senior team=== In November 2010, Schürrle received a call up to the [[Germany national football team|senior team]].{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/l246w-caps-germanys-rising-stars-2130556.html | title=Löw caps Germany's rising stars | publisher=The Independent | date = 11 November 2010 | accessdate = 19 May 2011 | first = David | last = Plummer}} He subsequently made his debut in a friendly against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]], appearing as a substitute in the 79th minute. Schürrle and [[Mario Götze]], who came on simultaneously, were the first two German international players to be born in [[German reunification|reunified Germany]].{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/preview?id=299387&cc=5739 |title=Kazakhs seek damage limitation against Germany |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=26 March 2011 |accessdate=19 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102072517/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/preview?id=299387 |archivedate=2 November 2012 }} On 29 May 2011, Schürrle scored his first goal for the senior team, during a friendly against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in a 2–1 win.{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2012/matches/round=2000293/match=2007928/index.html | title = Germany get better of Uruguay again | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 29 May 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} Schürrle was chosen in Germany's squad for their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|qualification]] for [[UEFA Euro 2012]]. He scored against [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]] in a 3–1 win, on 7 June 2011.{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002135/index.html | title = Gomez strikes in Azerbaijan as Germany march on | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 7 June 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} On 2 September 2011, he scored again in the 6–2 thrashing victory over Austria,{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002111/index.html | title = Germany stroll past Austria to reach EURO 2012 | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 2 September 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} in both cases coming on as a substitute. In the next qualification fixture against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] on 11 October 2011, Schürrle was rewarded with his first start in the Euro 2012 qualifiers, and scored in the 33rd minute chipping over [[Simon Mignolet]].{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/index.html | title = Germany stamp out Belgium's fire | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 11 October 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} After scoring three times during the campaign as Germany won ten out of ten games to top their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group A|group]] in their qualifiers, Schürrle was named in the Germany 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and was given the number nine shirt. He made his first appearance at Euro 2012 on 17 June, coming on as a substitute in the 64th minute for [[Lukas Podolski]], in the 2–1 win over [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]].{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15172/match=2003338/postmatch/report/index.html | title = German joy signals despair for Denmark | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 17 June 2012 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} On 15 October 2013, Schürrle scored a hat-trick in a 5–3 away win against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] in [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]].{{cite news|title=World Cup qualifiers: Germany end campaign with 5–3 win over Sweden|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/253857/report|accessdate=17 June 2014|work=[[Sky Sports News]]|date=15 October 2013}} Schürrle was named in Germany's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/germany/10810439/Germany-World-Cup-2014-squad.html|title=Germany World Cup 2014 squad|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=The Telegraph}} He made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut as a substitute in the team's opening match, a 4–0 victory over [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285106|title=Germany 4–0 Portugal|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=BBC | first = David | last = Ornstein}} In the 2–1 victory over [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|round of 16]], Schürrle came on for Götze as a half-time substitute and scored the opening goal of the match in the second minute of [[extra time]].{{cite news|last =Ornstein|first =David|title=Germany 2–1 Algeria|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27969924|accessdate=30 June 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=30 June 2014}} On 8 July, he scored Germany's final two goals after replacing [[Miroslav Klose]] as a 58th-minute substitute in a [[Mineirazo|7–1 semi-final victory]] over [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28102403|title=Brazil 1–7 Germany|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=9 July 2014|work=BBC | first = Phil | last = McNulty}} Schürrle again came on as a substitute in [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|the final]] against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]], replacing the injured [[Christoph Kramer]] in the first half. He provided the cross for Götze's winning goal in the 113th minute, as Germany won its fourth World Cup.{{cite news|last =McNulty|first =Phil|title=Germany 1–0 Argentina|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28181689|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 July 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015}} During [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualification|qualification]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]], Schürrle scored a hat-trick in a 7–0 away win over [[Gibraltar national football team|Gibraltar]] on 13 June 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33122742|title=Armenia 2-3 Portugal|date=14 June 2015|work=BBC}} ==Playing style== Schürrle usually plays as a winger but naturally positioned as a second striker.{{cite news|last=Dunbar|first=Ross|title=Chelsea target Andre Schürrle scouting report: All you need to know about the Germany star|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelsea-target-andre-schrrle-scouting-1835452|accessdate=6 May 2013|newspaper=The Mirror|date=1 May 2013}} One of Schürrle's "key assets" is his "long-distance sprinting on the counter-attack." Schürrle also has an excellent fitness level, work-rate and pace. Schürrle is considered to be a "good finisher" and "capable of executing counter-attacks effectively". He often likes to cut inside, shoot from distance and enjoys time on the ball.{{cite web|title=André Schürrle |url=http://www.whoscored.com/Players/77461|website=whoscored.com | accessdate = 11 January 2015}} ==Personal life== Schürrle was born in [[Ludwigshafen]], [[Rhineland-Palatinate]] to Luise{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/sport/fussball/das-magazin-11freunde-ueber-leverkusens-nationalspieler-andre-schuerrle-a-858172.html | title = Leverkusener Nationalspieler: Schnell, stark, Schürrle | publisher = Spiegel Online | date = 2 October 2012 | accessdate = 30 August 2013 | language = German }} and Joachim Schürrle.{{cite web | url=http://metro.co.uk/2012/12/04/andre-schurrle-will-resist-chelsea-transfer-for-now-says-father-3301024/ | title= Andre Schurrle will resist Chelsea transfer – for now, says father | publisher=Metro | date = 4 December 2012 | accessdate = 1 August 2013 | first = Massimo | last = Marioni}} When he was a youngster, he told in an interview with German football magazine ''[[11 Freunde]]'' that his idols were [[Michael Ballack]] and [[Raúl (footballer)|Raúl]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/0000317301.jsp|title=Ten things about Andre Schürrle|publisher=Bundesliga|accessdate=26 August 2018}} He is dating [[Kazakhs|Kazakh]]-born model Anna Sharypova whom he first met in January 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/718708/andre-schurrle-borussia-dortmund-crystal-palace-fc-fulham-fc-anna-sharypova-transferl|title=World cup winner in surprise move to Premier League as WAG posts CRYPTIC message|publisher=Daily Star|accessdate=27 August 2018}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|9 February 2019}}{{Soccerway|andre-schurrle/86503}}{{cite web | url = {{lead too short|date=May 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Håvard Nordtveit | fullname = Håvard Nordtveit{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}} | image = 2012-07 Nordtveit.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Nordtveit in July 2012 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|6|21|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Vats]], Norway | height = {{height|m=1.88}} | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] / [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Fulham FC|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]]) | clubnumber = 16 |youthclubs1 = Vats 94 |youthclubs2 = Skjold | youthyears1 = 1997–2003 | youthyears2 = 2003–2005 |clubs1 = [[FK Haugesund|Haugesund]] |clubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | years1 = 2006–2007 | years2 = 2007–2011 |caps1 = 10 |caps2 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |goals2 = 0 |nationalteam1 = Norway U16 |nationalteam2 = Norway U17 | nationalyears1 = 2006 | nationalyears2 = 2007 |nationalcaps1 = 10 |nationalcaps2 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 1 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | youthyears3 = 2006 |youthclubs3 = [[FK Haugesund|Haugesund]] | years3 = 2008 |clubs3 = → [[UD Salamanca|Salamanca]] (loan) |caps3 = 3 |goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2009 |clubs4 = → [[Lillestrøm SK|Lillestrøm]] (loan) |caps4 = 17 |goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2009–2010 |clubs5 = → [[1. FC Nürnberg]] (loan) |caps5 = 19 |goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2011–2016 |clubs6 = [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] |caps6 = 152 |goals6 = 10 | years7 = 2016–2017 |clubs7 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |caps7 = 16 |goals7 = 0 |years8 = 2017– |clubs8 = [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] |caps8 = 23 |goals8 = 0 |years9 = 2019– |clubs9 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) |caps9 = 1 |goals9 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2007–2008 |nationalteam3 = Norway U18 |nationalcaps3 = 4 |nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2007–2009 |nationalteam4 = [[Norway national under-19 football team|Norway U19]] |nationalcaps4 = 14 |nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2008–2013 |nationalteam5 = [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway U21]] |nationalcaps5 = 24 |nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2011– |nationalteam6 = [[Norway national football team|Norway]] |nationalcaps6 = 45 |nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 20:51, 22 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19 November 2018 }} '''Håvard Nordtveit''' (born 21 June 1990) is a Norwegian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for Fulham and the [[Norway national football team|Norway national team]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/sport/fussball/bundesliga/vereine/gladbach/2010/12/30/martin-stranzl-und-havard-nordtveit/sind-endlich-borussen.html |title=Stranzl und Nordtveit sind endlich Borussen |publisher=Bild |language=German |date=29 December 2010 |accessdate=30 December 2010 | first = Christian | last = Hornung}} ==Club career== ===Norway=== Nordtveit began his career as a youth in Norway with Vats 94 and Skjold. On 20 August 2006 he became the youngest player ever to play for [[FK Haugesund|Haugesund]],{{cite web|url=http://www.h-avis.no/article/20060822/SPORT/108220002 |title=Slipper Nordtveit til landslaget |publisher=Haugesund Avis |date=22 August 2006 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204171720/http://www.h-avis.no/article/20060822/SPORT/108220002 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} as he was selected for the starting line-up in a 2–0 victory against [[Sogndal Fotball|Sogndal]] at [[Haugesund stadion|Haugesund Stadium]]. He made nine league appearances during the [[Norwegian First Division 2007|following season]] for Haugesund in the [[Norwegian First Division]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nifs.no/personprofil.php?person_id=19752 |title=Nordtveit factfile – Norwegian & International Statistics of Football |publisher=Nifs.no |accessdate=15 March 2009}} That season he also appeared in the [[Norwegian Football Cup 2007|Norwegian Football Cup]], being in the starting line up in the 1–6 victory against Djerv 1919 (1st round),{{cite web|url=http://www.altomfotball.no/element.do?cmd=match&matchId=107582&tournamentId=110&seasonId=329 |title=Djerv 1919 - Haugesund |work=altomfotball |publisher=TV 2 |date=20 May 2007 |accessdate=7 October 2012}} and coming on in the 33rd minute in a 4–0 victory over [[Løv-Ham Fotball|Løv-Ham]] scoring one goal (third round).{{cite web|url=http://www.nifs.no/kampfakta.php?kamp_id=257026&land=1&t=14&u=2336 |title=Match Statistics – Norwegian & International Statistics of Football |publisher=Nifs.no |date=27 June 2007 |accessdate=15 March 2009}} Haugesund went all the way to [[2007 Norwegian Football Cup Final|the final]]. ===Arsenal=== [[Arsène Wenger]] travelled to Norway on 11 June 2007 to watch an Adeccoligaen match and begin negotiations to sign Nordtveit.{{cite web|url=http://fotballmagasinet.no/?mode=news&id=8169 |title=Arsene Wenger overvåket Håvard Nordtveit, og Haugesunds hjemmeseier |publisher=FotballMagasinet.no |first=Sten Christian |last=Kvindesland |accessdate=15 March 2009 |language=Norwegian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204100534/http://fotballmagasinet.no/?mode=news&id=8169 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} The members of the FKH board stated that the club had rejected Arsenal's initial bid. The player himself said that his club was asking for a "supernaturally high" transfer fee. The price being quoted in the Norwegian media was 20 million [[Norwegian krone]]r {{cite web|author=Øystein Eide |url=http://www.h-avis.no/article/20070611/SPORT/106110022/1062 |title=Er ikke 20 millioner nok? |publisher=Haugesunds Avis |date=30 April 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204171715/http://www.h-avis.no/article/20070611/SPORT/106110022/1062 |archivedate=4 February 2009 |df=dmy-all }} (approximately £1.7 million at the time). A transfer fee was later finalized on 3 July 2007 for £500,000 initially, rising to £2m after 40 first team appearances. He was thereafter given the shirt number 55 by the club. Haugesund captain [[Kevin Nicol]] and former Norway coach [[Nils Johan Semb]] went on to praise him as the brightest defensive talent in Europe.{{cite web|url=http://youngguns.wordpress.com/2008/02/19/havard-nordtveit-brightest-defensive-talent-in-europe/ |title=Håvard Nordtveit, Brightest Defensive Talent In Europe? |publisher=Youngguns.wordpress.com |date=19 February 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304123309/http://youngguns.wordpress.com/2008/02/19/havard-nordtveit-brightest-defensive-talent-in-europe/ |archivedate=4 March 2009 }} He made his Arsenal debut in their first pre-season friendly against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] on 14 July 2007. Nordtveit came on after half-time, replacing [[Kerrea Gilbert]].{{cite web|url=https://www.arsenal.com/match/report/0708pre-season-barnet-0-2-arsenal-match-report|title=Barnet 0-2 Arsenal|website=Arsenal.com}} He was named captain of Arsenal's [[Arsenal F.C. Reserves|reserve squad]] for the first match of the [[2007–08 Premier Reserve League|2007–08]] [[FA Premier Reserve League]] season. In an interview with Arsenal.com, Nordtveit said he was "honoured" to have been named captain, and that he hoped to continue in that role in the future.{{cite web|url=https://www.bleacherreport.com/amp/2248347-former-arsenal-young-gun-havard-nordtveits-second-chance-at-gladbach.amp.html|title=Former Arsenal Young Gun Havard Nordtveit's 2nd Chance at Gladbach|website=Bleacher Report.com}} In the final game of the [[2007–08 in English football|2007–08]] season he was named on the substitutes' bench in Arsenal's 1-0 win over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/7381801.stm|title=Sunderland 0-1 Arsenal|website=BBC.co.uk|date=2008-05-11}} ====2008–09 season==== On 18 August 2008, [[UD Salamanca|Salamanca]] of the [[Segunda División]] signed him on a six-month loan.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/8/main/2008/08/19/825027/arsenal-defender-loaned-to-salamanca|title=Arsenal Defender Loaned To Salamanca|website=Goal.com}} At Salamanca he played alongside another young [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] player, [[Pedro Roberto Silva Botelho|Pedro Botelho]]. He came off the bench to make his debut for UD Salamanca as they drew 1-1 with [[Sevilla Atlético]] in the second fixture of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com.ng/match?gameId=254121|title=UD Salamanca 1-1 Sevilla Atlético|website=ESPN FC.com}} Arsenal recalled him on 29 October, after becoming unhappy with the amount of playing time the Norwegian had received.{{cite web|url=http://www.nettavisen.no/innenriks/ibergen/article2348443.ece |title=Blir i Arsenal til jul |publisher=Nettavisen.no |date= 30 October 2008 |accessdate=15 March 2009 | language = Norwegian | first = Ørjan | last = Nilsson}} However, he was not eligible to play for the club until 1 January 2009. On 21 January, he finally made his first appearance for the reserves since spending time on-loan at UD Salamanca, in a 2–2 draw against the [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] reserves. On 10 March 2009, [[Norwegian Premier League]] outfit [[Lillestrøm SK|Lillestrøm]] signed Nordtveit on loan until 1 August 2009.{{cite news|first=Tom |last=Adams |title=Another Young Gun goes on loan |url=http://www.setanta.com/uk/Articles/Football/2009/03/10/Premier-League-Nordtveit-joins-Lillestrom/gnid-43850/ |publisher=Setanta Sports |date=10 March 2009 |accessdate=10 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090314041330/http://www.setanta.com/uk/Articles/Football/2009/03/10/Premier-League-Nordtveit-joins-Lillestrom/gnid-43850/ |archivedate=14 March 2009 }} He made his debut in the [[Eliteserien (football)|Norwegian Premier League]] in Lillestrøm's season opener away against [[Stabæk Fotball|Stabæk]] as a right fullback.{{cite web|url=https://www.nrk.no/sport/fotball/stabaek---lillestrom-spark-for-spark-1.6525047|title=Poengdeling i serieåpningen|language=Norwegian|website=NRK.no|date=2009-03-14}} This was a role which he retained during his time with the Norwegian side. ====2009–10 season==== On 28 July 2009, [[1. FC Nürnberg]] agreed a one-year loan deal for the Norwegian defender from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite web | url = http://sport.msn.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/512037/artikel_Havard-Nordtveit-kommt-zum-Club.html | title = Havard Nordtveit kommt zum Club | language = German | publisher = sport.msn.de | date = 28 July 2009 | accessdate = 3 October 2012}} Despite being a centre-back, his primary role at [[1. FC Nürnberg|Nürnberg]] was in the defensive midfield position.{{cite web | url = http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/nordtveit-i-can-follow-in-bould-s-footsteps | title = Nordtveit – I can follow in Bould's footsteps | publisher = arsenal.com | date = 3 August 2010 | accessdate = 3 October 2012 | first = Chris | last = Harris}} ===Borussia Mönchengladbach=== On 30 December 2010, Nordtveit joined [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] on a three-and-a-half-year contract, the transfer fee was £800,000.{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-why-i-will-let-nordtveit-leave|title=Wenger — Why I will let Nordtveit|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=31 December 2010|first=Chris|last=Harris|accessdate=19 May 2016}} He made his competitive debut for the club on 15 January 2011 in their [[Bundesliga]] match against Nürnberg.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/nurnberg-vs-mgladbach/220857|title=Match Report|website=Sky Sports.com}} Nordtveit scored his first goal in Germany, against [[1. FC Köln]] in a 5–1 victory for Borussia Mönchengladbach.{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2010-11/29/1013496/spielanalyse_borussia-mgladbach-15_1-fc-koeln-16.html|title=Gladbach 5-1 Koln|language=German|website=Kicker.de}} He was used mostly as a defensive midfielder, and established himself as a key player for Gladbach, taking the departed [[Michael Bradley (soccer)|Michael Bradley]]'s place in the squad.{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/havard-nordtveit-west-ham-bound-ball-winner-who-arsenal-could-regret-letting-go|title=Havard Nordtveit: The West Ham-bound ball winner who Arsenal could regret letting go|website=Four Four Two.com|date=2016-05-16}} ===West Ham United=== On 16 May 2016, it was announced that Nordtveit would be joining [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 1 July 2016 on a five-year contract.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/west-ham-united-havard-nordveit-borussia-monchengladbach-free-transfer|title=West Ham sign Havard Nordtveit from Borussia Mönchengladbach|newspaper=The Guardian|date=2016-05-16|last1=Association|first1=Press}} He made his official debut for the ''Hammers'' on 28 July in a 2–1 defeat to [[NK Domžale]] in the first leg of a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] qualifying match, playing the full 90 minutes.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/nk-domzale-vs-west-ham/362689|title=Hammers lose in Slovenia|website=Sky Sports.com}} ===Hoffenheim=== On 20 June 2017, West Ham announced that Nordtveit had signed for German side [[TSG Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]], for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/june/20-june/havard-nordtveit-signs-hoffenheim|title=Havard Nordtveit signs for Hoffenheim|date=20 June 2017|accessdate=20 June 2017|publisher=West Ham United}} ==International career== Nordtveit was a regular for the Norway U-17 in qualifying and they barely missed out on a place at the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship|2007 European Championships]]. After that he was promoted to the U-19 squad and was ever-present during the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship qualification|2009 European Championship qualifying]], scoring twice, but once again Norway did not make it past the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship elite qualification|elite qualification stage]]. He has been a regular for the [[Norway national under-21 football team|U-21]] team in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification Group 7|2011 European Championship]] qualifying campaign.{{cite news|title=U21-TROPP TIL EM-KVALIK I SERBIA |publisher=[[Football Association of Norway|fotball.no]] |url=http://www.fotball.no/Landslag_og_toppfotball/Landslag/Aldersbestemt_gutter/U20/2009/U21-tropp-til-EM-kvalik-i-Serbia/ |date=2 November 2009 |language=Norwegian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120802114729/http://www.fotball.no/Landslag_og_toppfotball/Landslag/Aldersbestemt_gutter/U20/2009/U21-tropp-til-EM-kvalik-i-Serbia/ |archivedate=2 August 2012 |df=dmy-all }} He made his first international appearance on 7 June 2011, in a friendly game against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]]. Nordtveit scored his first goal for the national team when he scored Norway's first goal in the friendly match against [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]] on 29 February 2012, which Norway won 3–0.{{cite web |url=http://www.tv2.no/sport/fotball/landslag/sterk-sluttspurt-sikret-norgeseier-3721276.html |language=Norwegian |title=Sterk sluttspurt sikret Norge-seier |work=tv2.no |publisher=[[TV 2 (Norway)|TV 2]] |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=29 February 2012}} Nordtveit later became a regular in the senior squad, but in October 2012 he was suspended from playing the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]] due to yellow cards.{{cite news |url=http://www.vg.no/sport/fotball/norsk/landslaget/artikkel.php?artid=10062288 |language=Norwegian |title=Nordtveit klar for U21-landskamp mot Frankrike |publisher=Verdens Gang |first=Øyvind |last=Askeland |first2=Sindre |last2=Øgar |date=15 October 2012 |accessdate=16 November 2012}} Nordtveit was instead called up for the under-21 side where he played an important role in the 5–3 win against [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] when Norway qualified for the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]].{{cite news |url=http://www.vg.no/sport/fotball/norsk/landslaget/artikkel.php?artid=10062475 |language=Norwegian |title=Nordtveit trodde EM røk da Frankrike reduserte |publisher=Verdens Gang |first=Øyvind |last=Askeland |date=17 October 2012 |accessdate=16 November 2012}} ===International goals=== :''Scores and results list Norway's goal tally first.'' {| class="wikitable" ! # !! {{Infobox football biography | name = Luciano Vietto | image = | caption = | fullname = Luciano Darío Vietto{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|12|5|df=y}} | birth_place = Balnearia, Argentina | height = 1.74 m | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[Atletico Madrid]]) | clubnumber = 19 | youthclubs1 = Independiente Balnearia | youthclubs2 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]] | youthyears1 = 2000–2008 | youthyears2 = 2008–2010 | youthyears3 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] | clubs1 = [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] | years1 = 2011–2014 | caps1 = 69 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] | caps2 = 32 | goals2 = 12 | years3 = 2015– | clubs3 = [[Atlético Madrid]] | caps3 = 25 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = → [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] (loan) | caps4 = 21 | goals4 = 6 | years5 = 2018 | clubs5 = → [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps6 = 17 | goals6 = 1 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | club-update = 08:57, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 19 February 2013 }} '''Luciano Darío Vietto''' ({{IPA-es|luˈsjano ðaˈɾi.o ˈβjeto|am}};{{efn-ua|In isolation, ''Darío'' and ''Vietto'' are pronounced {{IPA-es|daˈɾi.o|}} and {{IPA-es|ˈbjeto|}} respectively.}} born 5 December 1993) is an [[Argentina|Argentine]] professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], on loan from [[Atletico Madrid]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Vietto was born in the small town of Balnearia in the [[Córdoba Province, Argentina|Province of Córdoba]]. He joined his local team Independiente de Balnearia at the age of seven. At the age of 15, Vietto joined [[Argentine Primera División]] club [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]],{{cite web|url=http://pensionpincha.blogspot.ca/2008/04/luciano-vietto.html|title=Pensión de Estudiantes de La Plata: Luicano Vietto|trans-title=Board of Estudiantes de La Plata: Luciano Vietto|publisher=Pensión Del Pincha|language=es|date=25 August 2008|accessdate=6 August 2014}} but was released two years later. He subsequently moved to [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]]'s youth academy, after a failed trial at [[Rosario Central]].{{cite web|url=http://canchallena.lanacion.com.ar/1515212-vietto-la-joya-de-racing-que-estuvo-cerca-de-dejar-el-futbol|title=Vietto, la joya de Racing, que estuvo cerca de dejar el fútbol|trans-title=Vietto, Racing's pearl, who almost left football|publisher=Cancha Llena|language=es|date=7 October 2012|accessdate=10 August 2014}} ===Racing Club=== In 2011 Vietto signed his first professional contract, and was called up to the main squad by manager [[Diego Simeone]] on 25 October.{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/racing/Vietto-creer_0_578942367.html|title=Vietto para creer|trans-title=''Vietto'' to believe|publisher=[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]]|language=es|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He made his professional debut on a day later, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 1–1 home draw against [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espndeportes.com/futbol/cronica?id=325703&league=ARG.1|title=Racing igualó con Lanús y está más lejos de Boca|trans-title=Racing draws with Lanús and is farther of Boca|publisher=[[ESPN Deportes]]|language=es|date=26 October 2011|accessdate=10 August 2014}} Vietto was handed his first start on 3 September 2012, scoring his first professional goals (and his first [[hat-trick]]) in a 3–1 home success over [[San Martín de San Juan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espndeportes.com/futbol/cronica?id=352350&league=ARG.1|title=Racing le ganó a San Martín y quedó a un punto de Boca|trans-title=Racing defeated San Martin and ended up a point behind Boca|publisher=ESPN Deportes|language=es|date=3 September 2012|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He became a regular starter under [[Luis Zubeldía]] and contributed with 13 goals during [[2012–13 Argentine Primera División season|the campaign]], as his side only finished fifth.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/168277/luciano-vietto?season=2012|title=Luciano Vietto – 2012 season|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=7 August 2014}} After attracting interest from European clubs such as [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Serie A]] champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2201987/Liverpool-eye-Argentinian-starlet-Luciano-Vietto.html|title=Liverpool rival Juventus for Argentinian starlet Vietto|website=[[Daily Mail]]|date=12 September 2012|accessdate=7 August 2014}} Vietto signed a four-year contract extension with Racing on 26 March 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.racingclub.com.ar/plantel/nota/2013/03/1241_vietto-acordo-la-extension-de-su-contrato-con-el-club/|title=Vietto acordó la extensión de su contrato con el club|trans-title=Vietto agreed to a contract extension with the club|publisher=Racing Club's official website|language=es|date=26 March 2013|accessdate=7 August 2013}} Vietto appeared in 35 matches in [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|2013–14]], scoring five times. Highlights included a brace in a 3–1 away win against [[Club de Gimnasia y Esgrima La Plata|Gimansia La Plata]] on 2 November 2013.{{cite web|url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/futbol/cronica/_/id/373353|title=Racing logró su segundo triunfo en fila frente a Gimnasia|trans-title=Racing achieved its second successive triumph against Gimnasia|publisher=ESPN Deportes|language=es|date=2 November 2013|accessdate=22 March 2015}} ===Villarreal=== [[File:UEFA Euro League FC Salzburg gegen Villarreal 10.JPG|thumb|right|Vietto (3rd from left) lining up alongside his [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] teammates in 2015]] On 4 August 2014, Vietto signed a five-year deal with [[La Liga]] side [[Villarreal CF]],{{cite web|url=http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/6240-el-villarreal-ficha-al-delantero-luciano-vietto |title=El Villarreal CF ficha a Luciano Vietto |trans-title=Villarreal CF signs Luciano Vietto |publisher=Villarreal's official website |language=es |date=4 August 2014 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808051409/http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/6240-el-villarreal-ficha-al-delantero-luciano-vietto |archivedate=8 August 2014 |df= }} for a rumoured [[Euro|€]]5.5 million fee.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2014/08/04/futbol/equipos/villarreal/1407180982.html|title=El Villarreal ficha a Luciano Vietto por cinco temporadas|trans-title=Villarreal signs Luciano Vietto for five seasons|publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=4 August 2014|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He made his debut for the club on the 21st, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Ikechukwu Uche]] in a 3–0 [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Europa League play-off]] victory over [[FC Astana|Astana]],{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000586/match=2015117/index.html|title=Astana 0–3 Villarreal|publisher=UEFA.com|date=21 August 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} before scoring twice in the return leg at home.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000586/match=2015148/index.html|title=Villarreal 4–0 Astana|publisher=UEFA.com|date=28 August 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} Vietto made his La Liga debut on 24 August, replacing [[Giovani dos Santos]] for the last 10 minutes of a 2–0 away win against [[Valencian Community|Valencian]] rivals [[Levante UD]].{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/322141/report|title=La Liga: Ikechukwu Uche and Denis Cheryshev were on-target as Villarreal began their campaign with a 2-0 win at Levante|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=5 January 2015}} On 21 September he scored his first goals in the competition, netting a brace in a 4–2 home win over [[Rayo Vallecano]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_4/vil_ray/|title=El Villarreal llega a tiempo|trans-title=Villarreal arrives in time|publisher=Marca|language=es|date=21 September 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} Vietto added another double on 21 December, in a 3–0 win against the [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] also at the [[Estadio El Madrigal]].{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/322283/report|title=Primera Division: Luciano Vietto scored twice as Villarreal beat Deportivo 3-0|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 December 2014|accessdate=5 January 2015}} He finished the month with three goals, with his side moving to sixth position, and earning him the honour of [[La Liga Player of the Month]].{{cite news|url=http://www.lfp.es/en/news/the-bbva-prizes-for-decembers-best|title=The BBVA Prizes for December's best|publisher=[[Liga de Fútbol Profesional]]|date=14 January 2015|accessdate=14 January 2015}} ===Atlético Madrid=== On 22 June 2015, Villarreal confirmed Vietto had joined [[Atlético Madrid]] for a fee reported to be in the region of €20 million.{{cite web|title=Acuerdo con el Villarreal para el traspaso de Vietto|url=http://clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/vietto-ya-es-rojiblanco|website=clubatleticodemadrid.com|publisher=Atletico Madrid|accessdate=7 July 2015|language=es|date=7 July 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://au.eurosport.com/football/la-liga/2011-2012/vietto-joins-atletico_sto4792562/story.shtml|title=Luciano Vietto joins Atletico Madrid|publisher=EuroSport.com|date=22 June 2015}} Vietto scored his first goal for Atlético on 4 October 2015 as he tapped in a cross from [[Jackson Martínez]] to equalize against archrivals [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in a league match that eventually ended 1–1. ====Sevilla (loan)==== On 30 July 2016, Atlético Madrid and [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] reached an agreement for the loan of Vietto with an option to buy.{{cite web|url=http://en.atleticodemadrid.com/noticias/agreement-with-sevilla-fc-for-the-loan-of-vietto|title=Agreement with Sevilla FC for the loan of Vietto|website=Atlético Madrid|access-date=30 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sevillafc.es/actualidad/noticias/sevilla-fc-y-atletico-cierran-la-cesion-con-opcion-compra-de-vietto-y-el-0 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20160730115226/http://www.sevillafc.es/actualidad/noticias/sevilla-fc-y-atletico-cierran-la-cesion-con-opcion-compra-de-vietto-y-el-0 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=30 July 2016 |title=Sevilla FC y Atlético cierran la cesión con opción a compra de Vietto y el traspaso de Gameiro |trans-title=Sevilla FC and Atlético reached an agreement for the transfer of Vietto and Gameiro |language=Spanish |website=Sevilla FC |access-date=30 July 2016 }} ====Valencia (loan)==== On 4 January 2018, Vietto signed a loan deal with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] for the remainder of the season with an option to buy in the summer.{{cite web|url=http://en.valenciacf.com/ver/77470/comunicado-oficial-l-luciano-vietto.html|title=Club Statement Luciano Vietto|website=Valencia CF|access-date=4 January 2018}} Vietto made his debut against Girona coming on as a sub. In a Copa Del Rey fixture against Las Palmas, Vietto scored his first ever [[hat-trick]] in Spain. ====Fulham (loan)==== On 9 August 2018 he joined English Premier League club Fulham on a season long loan.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45084054 |title=Fulham: Andre-Frank Anguissa, Joe Bryan, Sergio Rico and Luciano Vietto set to join |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2018 |accessdate=9 August 2018}} ==International career== ===Youth teams=== On 9 January 2013, Vietto made his international debut for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina national under-20 team]] against [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile]] at [[2013 South American Youth Championship|the year]]'s [[South American Youth Championship]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/358963/gamecast.html|title=Argentina U20 v Chile U20|publisher=ESPN FC|date=9 January 2013|accessdate=8 August 2014}} He scored his first goal four days later, but in a 1–2 loss against [[Paraguay national under-20 football team|Paraguay]], and finished the tournament with two goals in four games. ==Career statistics== {{Updated|match played 29 January {{EngvarB|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Joe Bryan | image = File:2017joebryanbcfc.jpg | caption = Bryan in action for [[Bristol City]] in 2017. | fullname = Joseph Edward Bryan<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |title=EFL: Retained list: 2015/16 |publisher=English Football League |page=13 |format=PDF |accessdate=26 June 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161202052144/http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |archivedate=2 December 2016 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|9|17|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bristol]], England | height = {{height|ft=5|in=7}}<ref>{{cite web|title=J. Bryan|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/joe--bryan/200580/|work=Soccerway|publisher=Global Sports Media|accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref> | position = [[Left Back]] / [[Wingback (soccer)|Wingback]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | clubnumber = 23 | youthyears1 = 2009–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] | years1 = 2011–2018 | clubs1 = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] | caps1 = 203 | goals1 = 16 | years2 = 2011–2012 | clubs2 = → [[Bath City F.C.|Bath City]] (loan) | caps2 = 4 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2013 | clubs3 = → [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] (loan) | caps3 = 10 | goals3 = 1 |years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps4 = 16 | goals4 = 0 | club-update = 09:04, 10 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Joseph Edward Bryan''' (born 17 September 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left-back]] for [[Premier League]] side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. He is also capable as a left-sided [[midfielder]] and left-sided wing-back. He has also had loan spells with [[Bath City F.C.|Bath City]] and [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]]. A product of Bristol City's youth academy, consistently excellent performances on the pitch have led to Bryan being hailed as one of the academy's best success stories.
==Club career==
===Bristol City=== Bryan was born and raised in the area of [[Bristol]]. He came through his [[Bristol City F.C.|local team's]] youth levels; signing his first professional contract in 2011, agreeing terms to be a Bristol City player for at least two years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10327~2329300,00.html |publisher=This Is Devon |title=Five Offered Pro Deals |date=9 March 2012 |accessdate=9 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110407072718/http://www.bcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10327~2329300%2C00.html |archivedate= 7 April 2011 |df= }}</ref>
On 24 November 2011, Bryan joined [[Conference National]] side [[Bath City F.C.|Bath City]] on a two-month loan deal, effectively lasting until January.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15872244| publisher=BBC Sport | title=Bristol City's Joe Bryan & Aaron-Amadi Holloway join Bath City | date=24 November 2011 |accessdate=9 March 2012}}</ref> He scored in a 3–1 win over [[A.F.C. Telford United]].
He made his professional debut for Bristol on 6 March 2012, in a 3–2 win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] at [[Ashton Gate Stadium|Ashton Gate]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Joe-Bryan-handed-Bristol-City-debut/story-15412079-detail/story.html| publisher=This is Bristol| title=Joe Bryan handed Bristol City debut| date=6 March 2012| accessdate=9 March 2012| archive-url=https://archive.is/20130505083757/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Joe-Bryan-handed-Bristol-City-debut/story-15412079-detail/story.html| archive-date=5 May 2013| dead-url=yes| df=dmy-all}}</ref> In March 2013, he joined [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Joe Bryan: Bristol City prospect loaned to Plymouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21759569|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=14 March 2013|date=12 March 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Joe Bryan joins Plymouth Argyle on loan from Championship club Bristol City|url=http://www.thisisplymouth.co.uk/Joe-Bryan-joins-Plymouth-Argyle-loan-Championship/story-18399343-detail/story.html|accessdate=14 March 2013|newspaper=The Plymouth Herald|date=13 March 2013}}</ref> Bryan made his debut for Plymouth the same day against [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] and scored his first Football League goal at [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] in April.<ref>{{cite news|title=Loan signing Joe Bryan praised for his performances by Plymouth Argyle manager John Sheridan|url=http://www.thisisplymouth.co.uk/Loan-signing-Joe-Bryan-praised-performances/story-18652281-detail/story.html|accessdate=9 September 2013|newspaper=The Plymouth Herald|date=9 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="ten">{{cite news|title=Joe Bryan targets first team football at Bristol City after Plymouth Argyle loan|url=http://www.thisisplymouth.co.uk/Joe-Bryan-targets-team-football-Bristol-City/story-18866177-detail/story.html|accessdate=9 September 2013|newspaper=The Plymouth Herald|date=3 May 2013}}</ref>
He returned to Bristol City at the end of the season having played on the left side of midfield in ten consecutive games for Argyle.<ref name="ten"/> Bryan scored his first goal for City in the [[Bristol derby]] with [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Rovers]] in September,<ref>{{cite web|title=Joe Bryan: Bristol City midfielder's delight at first goal for club|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23970694|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=9 September 2013|date=5 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=City 2 Rovers 1: Bryan picks his moment to be a hero|url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/City-2-Rovers-1-Bryan-picks-moment-hero/story-19755554-detail/story.html|accessdate=9 September 2013|newspaper=Bristol Post|date=5 September 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150610224559/http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/City-2-Rovers-1-Bryan-picks-moment-hero/story-19755554-detail/story.html|archive-date=10 June 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and his first league goal for the club came in November against [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]]. In June 2015 he signed a contract extension keeping him at Bristol City until 2019.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bryan agrees contract extension|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/bryan-agrees-contract-extension-2486376.aspx|publisher=Bristol City|accessdate=9 June 2015|date=9 June 2015}}</ref> The 2016–17 campaign saw Joe Bryan become statistically the best left back in the division.<ref>{{cite web|title=Where the stats say city need to strengthen|url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/stats-say-bristol-city-need-70884}}</ref>
Bryan starred in City's 2017–18 [[EFL Cup]] run to the semi finals, scoring the third goal in a 4–1 win against [[Premier League]] side [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] and then going on to score the first goal in the club's 2–1 win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in the 2017–2018 [[EFL Cup]] quarter final at Ashton Gate.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/bryans-cup-screamer-voted-goal-of-the-round/|title=Bryan's cup screamer voted goal of the round|website=Bristol City}}</ref><ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42334221</ref>
===Fulham=== On 9 August 2018, Bryan signed for newly-promoted [[Premier League]] club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] for a reported transfer fee reported to be in the region of £6 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45084054 |title=Fulham: Andre-Frank Anguissa, Joe Bryan, Sergio Rico and Luciano Vietto set to join |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2018 |accessdate=9 August 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Fulham in an [[EFL Cup]] tie against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] on 25 September 2018.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham ease past Millwall and introduce teenage prospect |url=https://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/fulham-ease-past-millwall-and-introduce-teenage-prospect-37355070.html|accessdate=26 September 2018|publisher=belfasttelegraph.co.uk|date=25 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Bryan was selected by the [[Scotland national under-21 football team]] in October 2012,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.scottishfa.co.uk/scottish_fa_news.cfm?page=2986&newsCategoryID=6&newsID=10701 |title=Scotland Under-21 squad announced for friendly matches|date=2 October 2012|accessdate=2 October 2012|work=www.scottishfa.co.uk|publisher=Scottish Football Association}}</ref> but could not play due to a concussion he received playing for Bristol City against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].
==Personal life==
Bryan's father, Alan, is a cardiac surgeon, specializing in aortic surgery.<ref>{{cite news|last1=White|first1=Jim|authorlink1=Jim White (journalist)|title=Joe Bryan's dad saved my father’s life, reveals grateful Bristol City manager Lee Johnson after famous win against Manchester United|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/12/21/joe-bryans-dad-saved-fathers-life-reveals-grateful-bristol-city/|accessdate=22 December 2017|work=The Telegraph|date=21 December 2017|location=London}}</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 12 January 2019}}<ref>{{soccerbase|63310|Joe Bryan}}</ref>
